subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Enhanced Fujita Scale
description: A 60-second lesson on The Enhanced Fujita Scale.

hook.text: An EF0 tornado snaps tree branches. An EF5 rips houses off their foundations entirely.

buildup.text: The Enhanced Fujita Scale rates tornadoes from EF0 to EF5 based on damage, not wind speed.

discovery.text: Tornado winds can't be measured directly. Scientists assess damage to estimate peak speeds.

twist.text: EF5 tornadoes are extremely rare â€” fewer than one per year on average in the US.

climax.text: The 2011 Joplin, Missouri EF5 tornado killed 158 people in less than 30 minutes.

punchline.text: We rate tornadoes by what they leave behind â€” or don't.

quiz.question: How is a tornado's EF rating determined?
options: By assessing the damage it causes
